item.title: Raising a glass to World Malbec Day | The Royal Gazette:Bermuda Lifestyle
item.description:
Raising a glass to World Malbec Day | The Royal Gazette:Bermuda Lifestyle

The first World Malbec Day took place across 36 countries on April 17, 2011. (We took part as well but I am not sure if this was counted). It was Argentina that conceived the idea, as it was there that this grape, that had been cultivated in southern France since Roman times, really flourished.

item.title: 6 Wines To Uncork On World Malbec Day
item.description:
6 Wines To Uncork On World Malbec Day

Spring is coming and so is the rosé! As long as we don't have another shortage like last year everything should be just splendid. But first, did you know that April 17th is World Malbec Day? Don't worry, neither did we, but this is the perfect excuse to finish up all the red wine you have just in time for rosé season.

item.title: Argentina: Malbec land - Travel - NZ Herald News
item.description:
Argentina: Malbec land - Travel - NZ Herald News

By Grace Ramirez Grace Ramirez - chef, TV personality and author- shares her Mendoza highlights. Mendoza, at the northern central part of Argentina, is almost straight across from Santiago, Chile. It is renowned for great wines, especially malbecs, but in summer, you can take an excursion on horseback from Mendoza to Santiago, just like San Martin did in the good old conquering days.

item.title: Howell: Malbec World Day is Sunday
item.description:
Howell: Malbec World Day is Sunday

You've gotta suspect that a wine has a pretty good following when it gets its own holiday. This Sunday, April 17, is Malbec World Day. Yippee. That's all I need for an excuse to uncork one of the world's most popular reds. This date was not chosen at random.

item.title: Malbec Day celebrations this weekend in London's Camden Market
item.description:
Malbec Day celebrations this weekend in London's Camden Market

WOFA Mobile Wine Bar will be located at Camden Market; the idea is to bring Buenos Aires San Telmo and the bustling streets of Palermo Soho, to London. Organizers promise Camden Market will be full of non-stop activities and a place to come and enjoy food and drink, and a display of Argentine tradition Sunday will mark the fifth Malbec Wine Day.

item.title: Malbec World Day readies for sixth edition
item.description:
Malbec World Day readies for sixth edition

7th April, 2016 by Lauren Eads Together with the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the Argentina Wine Corporation, Wines of Argentina (WofA) will celebrate Malbec World Day on 17 April, however events will take place throughout April with the aim of emphasising the grape's status as a "classic" Argentine variety.

item.title: Derbyshire wine expert celebrates the forthcoming World Malbec Day
item.description:
Derbyshire wine expert celebrates the forthcoming World Malbec Day

Derbyshire wine merchant Tim Worth, from Worth Brothers, in Kirk Langley, looks at World Malbec Day in his column. NEXT Sunday, red wine drinkers across the globe will be raising their glasses to celebrate World Malbec Day.

item.title: Eat Wine and Drink Empanadas with Gauchito Gil
item.description:
Eat Wine and Drink Empanadas with Gauchito Gil

Or is it the other way around? Dan Sims of Bottle Shop Concepts shows us how to have fun with wine events. Wine has a problem. Actually, wine is perfect. Wine events have a problem. They're boring. That's why Dan Sims started his own wine events company, Bottle Shop Concepts.

item.title: Why Malbecs are wines of mass consumption
item.description:
Why Malbecs are wines of mass consumption

If I were to choose an acronym to promote my luxury product, WMD wouldn't be my first choice. It's hardly redolent of balmy days spent quaffing a glass of full bodied vino. But World Malbec Day - now sheepishly retooled as Malbec World Day - celebrates its third anniversary on 17 April.

item.title: Beyond Malbec
item.description:
Beyond Malbec

CV Age: 29Born: MendozaLives: Yerevan, ArmeniaDegree: Oenology degree at Juan Agustin Maza University Mendoza Job: Oenologist at Karas Wines, ArmeniaCurrently reading: Gran inversor Last movie: Fast and Furious 7 in RussianCan't live without: wine A mendocino oenologist, Gabriel Rogel had no real plans to move from his wine-making province home until, curious to see what else what was out there, sent a job application - to work in Armenia.
